body:
I suggest blocking them in your computers' hosts file so you can't accidentally browse

i.redd.it
www.reddit.com
old.reddit.com
redit.com

That alone has probably prevented me from going to the site by accident or muscle-memory, one or more times a day. 

And , if you do need to browse, and you're on google chrome, just preface the 'failed to load' page URL with "cache:"  and push enter

like thus! 

https://i.imgur.com/w0xKpB4.png

(you can get to the same google cache without chrome but it's a lot longer URL and in chrome, it does the needful to load the page with the cache: modifier alone. ) 

If each person who was dissatisfied with reddit modified their host to block the site ( regardless of whether they were ruqqus users)  reddit would see their traffic drop even faster, while still allowing users to access useful data from the site.
body_html:
I suggest blocking them in your computers' hosts file so you can't accidentally browse

i.redd.it www.reddit.com old.reddit.com redit.com

That alone has probably prevented me from going to the site by accident or muscle-memory, one or more times a day.

And , if you do need to browse, and you're on google chrome, just preface the 'failed to load' page URL with "cache:" and push enter

like thus!

https://i.imgur.com/w0xKpB4.png

(you can get to the same google cache without chrome but it's a lot longer URL and in chrome, it does the needful to load the page with the cache: modifier alone. )

If each person who was dissatisfied with reddit modified their host to block the site ( regardless of whether they were ruqqus users) reddit would see their traffic drop even faster, while still allowing users to access useful data from the site.

it really just needs a new competitor to take it down.

I can't believe what happened to reddit.  How has it fucked up so badly that there's only a few topics that are "acceptable" and hate on white people is fine, and even encouraged in their bylaws.  Aren't most of their users white?  That seems like a, well, pretty myopic rule to impose.
